page.title: 05Grove Farm,Holbeach Hurn.
page.content: Michael Thompsons farm at Grove Farm is now best known for its big herd of pedigree Charolais cattle.They were introduced in 1967 when 4 were bought.All the animals help to fertilise the soil,Mr. Thompson believes in organic farming.He says it makes no difference financially but is better for conservation.They now have 70 Charolais and a big entry in the Charolais Herd book.People come from all over the world to buy from the Grove Farm herd.Each animal has an ear tag impregnated with something to keep the flies away.They all have a name and a number.Each year has a letter and that goes with the number so it is easy to keep worldwide records on Charolais cows.The bulls are ringed at about 9-10 mths.The Charolais is a very hardy beast,gives good meat and breeds well.
